description: Individual pithiviers are sure to impress your guests and these mushroom ones are big on hearty flavour.
name: Mushroom Pithivier Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 0.25 punnet sage, leaves picked, finely chopped
4 sheets frozen puff pastry, partially thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 200°C/180°C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper.

Melt butter in a large frying pan over high heat. Cook mushrooms for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until tender and liquid has evaporated. Add sage, shallot and garlic, then cook for 2 minutes, stirring, or until shallot has softened. Add mustard, paste, cream and 2 tbs relish, then stir to combine. Transfer mushroom mixture to a bowl and set aside to cool for 30 minutes.
Using a 9cm-round cutter, cut 6 rounds from pastry and transfer to tray. Place 1/4 cup mushroom mixture in centre of each round, leaving a 1cm border. Brush border with a little egg.

Using a 12cm-round cutter, cut 6 rounds from remaining pastry. Using a small, sharp knife, make a small hole in centre of each round. Brush with a little egg. Using the back of a small, sharp knife, score lines from centre of pastry to the edge. Place pastry rounds (scored-sides up) Mover filling, pressing edges to seal. Brush pastry tops with a little more egg. Bake for 25 minutes or until pastry is golden and puffed. Serve with spinach and remaining relish.
